channel.title: RS without free trade
channel.description:
Earlier today I saw a thread at RS forums about bringing back trade limits. I personally am up for the idea, sure I will miss giving/receiving donations but I think it is best for the game. If the trade limit returns then maybe the goldfarming bots will reduce and gambling will finally die, but I think pkers would strongly be affected leading to riots once again.
What are your opinions on this and do you believe bringing back trade limits would save the game at some point?

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Please shuddup both of you. You’re both going completely off topic.

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m assuming you’ve taken what I said the wrong way. Yes, I grew up with a lot of aggressive people but if its not obvious I use my brain a lot more than I use my fists. I was saying I’m an asshole because of other things, I have no intention of making someone ever cry.
When I said asshole, its not intentional I just do it and don’t care enough to stop doing it.
Have you forgotten I look down at people etc a lot, its not intention its just I feel people like you are pretty dumb because you act like it in my opinion. Notice I said in my opinion, so don’t take it offensively. Just saying what I think like you said what you think however I suspect yours was actually an attempt to be insulting.

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I’d rather be a tiny bit of an asshole than a complete hardass, because people really despise hardasses

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Its bizzarre really, considering the way I live and I’ve grown up somehow I show more care to others feelings than you and you donate a lot of money to charity etc.
Ty for the moral boost, was beginning to think I was a complete asshole.

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I completely understand where you are coming from, and I still don’t care. I know you may think that calling someone an idiot is a terrible terrible thing, all I can say is welcome to the internet. There’s a lot worse shit here, this forum isn’t a kindergarten classroom, or a place for you specifically to try and impose your views on everyone (which for you specifically is why a lot of your reports get ignored). There’s still a line of course.

And yes, a lot of the time I ignore it. Usually I’ll listen to someone once, and then try to explain my actions (or lack of actions) to them. If they continue after that, it’s clear we just have a difference in opinion and there’s no reason for me to listen to them anymore, and they can go complain to Taharok instead (love you Taharok).

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Thats exactly whats wrong ^, you should care.
Of course you can’t please everyone but you shouldn’t ignore them (us in this case) because you believe we are wrong.

Even if we are wrong (not saying we are), you should try to understand where we are coming from. Gaining a better understanding of things means you can deal with things better, ignoring things is the complete opposite.
Saying you don’t care suggests you ignore it.

Moparscape isn’t a big ass community where nobody knows each other, its a community where a lot of people know each other. You should take time out of your day to understand why we feel like this and if you truly understood you’d deal with it a lot better than you are. But hey as I said before, I always expect too much from people.

Read full topic

@davidi2 wrote:

There will always be whiners, and I don’t care about them

item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Now I feel like what I complained to yous about I’m not alone in feeling but its kl just side sweep it as usual.

I wonder if the following sounds familiar

rip4d:

Regardless if he knows what he is talking about or not, a moderator shouldn’t be calling a member an idiot, it simply sets a bad example.

Sorry for the offtopic post, felt like I had to say it even though its a waste of my time :L.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I will happily call him an idiot again.

He is being an idiot. And I don’t think anyone would have had a problem with others calling him an idiot either (as Taharok showed :P), so I don’t see how that’s a bad example.

I don’t care who you are (Junior Member or Moparian), don’t go warmongering without a shred of evidence or even just cause and expect to not be called an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:53, topic:460179”]The trade limit doesn’t achieve anything, except MAYBE reducing scamming. As was said though, you need to be rather naive to get scammed. Jagex can use other avenues (like reporting) to try and reduce scamming, but adding a feature like the trade limit just to undermine scamming would be a massive inconvenience for everyone else.

As far as preventing illegitimate trades, their trade/item flow analysis system will be significantly more effective and, since it’s incognito, players are not inconvenienced in the slightest.[/quote]
I agree with this completely. If your stupid enough to believe that a person can trim your Armour, then you shouldn’t even be playing. Jagex knows it too, let the people waste their time. I enjoy free trade because I am not stupid enough to fall for the idiotic scams. Most people are like that too, just because the younger population can’t have common sense then why punish all of us? I remember when there was no free trade, the runescape economy mostly revolved around the G.E. which sucked, I loved the street prices and stuff before that. Eh anyways yeah

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The trade limit doesn’t achieve anything, except MAYBE reducing scamming. As was said though, you need to be rather naive to get scammed. Jagex can use other avenues (like reporting) to try and reduce scamming, but adding a feature like the trade limit just to undermine scamming would be a massive inconvenience for everyone else.

As far as preventing illegitimate trades, their trade/item flow analysis system will be significantly more effective and, since it’s incognito, players are not inconvenienced in the slightest.

Read full topic

item.title: RS without free trade
item.dc:creator: @SCFTW SCFTW
item.description:
@SCFTW wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:51, topic:460179”][quote author=SCFTW link=topic=563095.msg4111591#msg4111591 date=1348571017]

It would balance the economy of the game. Billions of gp’s are handled away daily. So i think that the trade limit should be brought back.

It would *limit the economy of the game.

At least no scamming or gambling, thats what i want.

If you get scammed then you’re stupid. Don’t give anyone your money unless you have a good deal in the trade window.

I dont think i have ever got scammed, but maybe when i was a noob. Also i don’t usually buy stuff from other people, i buy ma st00f from G.E.
[/quote]

(I didn’t mean “you” as in you personally, I meant it as in “one” Sorry if you thought I was being rude)
I buy my stuff from the GE too :P[/quote]

That’s alright, i didn’t take it personally or anything like that…

Read full topic
